author: ryanleeschneider
content:
What if the order of operation was changed, would this work instead?

- I tell a "staking faucet" on Goerli that I want to stake w/ a new public key K
- That faucet deposits say 31.99 Eth on behalf of my public key K
- I now go through the normal flow for setting up a validator on goerli, but only need to include 0.1 Eth in my signed deposit

Actually, maybe better, the "staking faucet" consumes the same `deposit_data-*.json` files, so the flow is something like:

- User runs `deposit new-mnemonic --chain=goerli --num_validators=1 --use-staking-faucet=31.99` (the new `use-staking-faucet` option basically tells the deposit CLI to change the `amount`field in the deposit_data file to `REQUIRED_AMOUNT - $use_staking_faucet_argument` so in this case `amount` would be `10000000` since we are asking the faucet to cover 31.99 for us)
- User then uploads `deposit_data-*.json` to the new "staking faucet" which in turn deposits the amount necessary on behalf of the user
- The user then completes the normal launchpad flow, signing a tx to deposit `0.1` GoEth

Obviously this flow requires a new faucet and some changes to the deposit tool(s) but doesn't require any on-chain changes and just adds a step in the launchpad vs fundamentally changing the flow between mainnet and goerli.
